event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The platform administrator should check the AC power connections and schedule a service action, if necessary. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: PSU has detected a loss of AC power.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
PSU has detected a loss of AC power.

The probable cause is the loss of input AC power to the power supply.

Sufficient operational PSUs will increase all fans to high speed.
Insufficient operational PSUs will power down the platform.



The recommended service action for this event is outlined in the steps below.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:28:33 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: 55b0bdc9-2c60-4dca-b2d2-8a1f1fd26a0e
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8004-MP for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8004-MP, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:28:33 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 55b0bdc9-2c60-4dca-b2d2-8a1f1fd26a0e
   DESC: PSU has detected a loss of AC power.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8004-MP for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The PSU will be deconfigured. If sufficient operational PSU's remain, the fan speeds of
   all fans will be increased. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for
   additional information.
   IMPACT: If there are insufficient operational PSU's, the platform will be powered down.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: The platform administrator should check the AC power connections and schedule a
   service action, if necessary. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article
   for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 55b0bdc9-2c60-4dca-b2d2-8a1f1fd26a0e

   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 27 15:28:33.5516 55b0bdc9-2c60-4dca-b2d2-8a1f1fd26a0e SCF-8004-MP
     100%  fault.chassis.env.power.loss

           Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/psu=0
                  Affects: -
                  FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                       server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:
                       part=CA01022-0690:revision=31/component=/PSU#0


Step 3. Platform administrator should investigate the cause of AC power loss.
        
           If unable to identify the cause of AC power loss,
             then contact your Authorized Service Provider.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: If there are insufficient operational PSU's, the platform will be powered down. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The PSU will be deconfigured. If sufficient operational PSU's remain, the fan speeds of all fans will be increased. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: PSU detected a loss of AC power.
